Package akka.testkit

Interface Summary
DefaultTimeout

TestActor.Message  
TestActorRefSpec.TActor  
TestEvent Implementation helpers of the EventFilter facilities: send `Mute` to the TestEventListener to install a filter, and `UnMute` to deinstall it.
TestKitBase Implementation trait behind the TestKit class: you may use this if inheriting from a concrete class is not possible.
 

Class Summary
AkkaSpec  
AkkaSpec$

CallingThreadDispatcher  
CallingThreadDispatcher$  
CallingThreadDispatcherConfigurator  
CallingThreadMailbox  
CustomEventFilter Custom event filter when the others do not fit the bill.
CustomEventFilter$  
DebugFilter Filter which matches Debug events, if they satisfy the given criteria: source, if given, applies a filter on the event’s origin message applies a filter on the event’s message (either with String.startsWith or Regex.findFirstIn().isDefined) If you want to match all Debug events, the most efficient is to use Left("").
DebugFilter$  
ErrorFilter Filter which matches Error events, if they satisfy the given criteria: throwable applies an upper bound on the type of exception contained in the Error event source, if given, applies a filter on the event’s origin message applies a filter on the event’s message (either with String.startsWith or Regex.findFirstIn().isDefined); if the message itself does not match, the match is retried with the contained Exception’s message; if both are null, the filter always matches if at the same time the Exception’s stack trace is empty (this catches JVM-omitted “fast-throw” exceptions) If you want to match all Error events, the most efficient is to use Left("").
ErrorFilter$  
EventFilter Facilities for selectively filtering out expected events from logging so that you can keep your test run’s console output clean and do not miss real error messages.
EventFilter$ Facilities for selectively filtering out expected events from logging so that you can keep your test run’s console output clean and do not miss real error messages.
ExtractRoute  
ExtractRoute$ This object can be used to extract the `Route` out of a RoutedActorRef.
InfoFilter Filter which matches Info events, if they satisfy the given criteria: source, if given, applies a filter on the event’s origin message applies a filter on the event’s message (either with String.startsWith or Regex.findFirstIn().isDefined) If you want to match all Info events, the most efficient is to use Left("").
InfoFilter$
